New Records: Georgia secured their place in the knockout stages in their major tournament debut.
Cristiano Ronaldo's pursuit of becoming the oldest player ever to score at a Euros continues.
Key Match Events: Khvicha Kvaratskhelia scored in the second minute.
Georges Mikautadze converted a second-half penalty.
Cristiano Ronaldo was substituted on 66 minutes with only a booking to show for his efforts.
Pre-Game Insights: Georgia manager Willy Sagnol emphasized playing with ambition and not just going to Germany for shopping or tourism.
Post-Match Reflections: Cristiano Ronaldo showed visible frustration after being substituted, kicking a water bottle before settling on the bench.
Georgia manager Willy Sagnol reflected on his experience in big tournaments helping his players.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Football is growing in popularity in Georgia, with an emphasis on developing and nurturing young talent.
Georgia hosted the Under-19s Euros in 2017 and co-hosted the Under-21 Euros with Romania last year.
